messages.content: As an AI assistant, my role is to meticulously analyze criminal justice documents and extract information about law enforcement personnel. The response will contain: 1) The name of a law enforcement personnel. The individual's name must be prefixed with one of the following titles to be in law enforcement: Detective, Sergeant, Lieutenant, Captain, Deputy, Officer, Patrol Officer, Criminalist, Technician, Coroner, or Dr. Please prefix the name with 'Officer Name:  I will derive this data from the following paragraph: REPORT: 458-9945-BB DATE: 09/10/23  At about 1:45 PM, the office of Deputy A. X. Black was buzzed regarding vandalism at Broad Street Park. Witnesses, namely Mrs. Wilson and Mr. Carter, observed a group of teenagers in the act. OFFICER MUST SEND THIS TO: CRIMINAL DIVISION. ALERT DETAILS. Sgt. Y. Y. Yale - ACTIVITIES Lt. Black, Sr.. 1st RESPONDING.  Detective Z. A. Alpha along with Dect. B. C. Bravo were quick to the scene. JONES PARK 12:55 Vandalism. Park rangers provided insight, while Mr. Carter presented mobile footage. Recorded Clips. Tech Ian did a brief analysis.  FORWARD AGAIN TO: CRIMINAL DIVISION 4 - STATUS [SELECT] Dect. Alpha Sr, Dect. Bravo, Sgt. Yale OPERATIONS Lt. Black, Sr. CASE INVOLVED Carter, Samuel 62 Wide Street, Brookside, Wyoming 299-432. 58429. JONES PARK 14:55 Vandalism.  Before 3 PM, Dect. Alpha and Bravo, under the oversight of Lieutenant Black, Sr., noticed a pattern linked to earlier crimes. Captain D. E. Echo ordered more surveillance. Sergeant F. G. Golf and Sgt. H. I. India reported similar markers in adjacent zones. Come 5 PM, four more locations verified comparable damage.  FORWARD IMMEDIATELY TO: CRIMINAL DIVISION 4 - STATUS [PICK] Dect. Alpha Sr, Dect. Bravo, Sgt. Golf OPERATIONS Lt. Black CASE SUMMARY - Vandalism File (1) Damage Photos (2) Park Staff Narratives (3) Eye Witness Accounts (4) Digital Recordings (5) Graffiti Analyses (6) Site Maps INFORM DIRECTOR DEPUTY OVERSEER L. M. Lima D.C.P.D. 35.220 D98 4944 Carter, SAM NAME: ADDRESS: CONTACT: 492-3768 DETECTIVE: Z. ALPHA CASE: 458-6690- 991 CRIME: 12:55 REFERENCE ID 94112 - REGISTERED John White DATE 9/12/23 SEND DIRECT: CRIMINAL DIVISION CONTINUED.
Identify each individual in the transcript, by name, who are directly referred to as officers, sergeants, lieutenants, captains, detectives, homicide officers, and crime lab personnel.

Officer Name: Deputy A. X. Black  
Officer Context: At about 1:45 PM, the office of Deputy A. X. Black was buzzed regarding vandalism at Broad Street Park.  
Officer Role: Deputy 

Officer Name: Sgt. Y. Y. Yale  
Officer Context: Sgt. Y. Y. Yale - ACTIVITIES  
Officer Role: Sergeant 

Officer Name: Detective Z. A. Alpha  
Officer Context: Detective Z. A. Alpha along with Dect. B. C. Bravo were quick to the scene.  
Officer Role: Detective 

Officer Name: Dect. B. C. Bravo  
Officer Context: Detective Z. A. Alpha along with Dect. B. C. Bravo were quick to the scene.  
Officer Role: Detective 

Officer Name: Tech Ian  
Officer Context: Recorded Clips. Tech Ian did a brief analysis.  
Officer Role: Technician 

Officer Name: Lieutenant Black, Sr.  
Officer Context: Before 3 PM, Dect. Alpha and Bravo, under the oversight of Lieutenant Black, Sr., noticed a pattern linked to earlier crimes.  
Officer Role: Lieutenant 

Officer Name: Captain D. E. Echo  
Officer Context: Captain D. E. Echo ordered more surveillance.  
Officer Role: Captain 

Officer Name: Sergeant F. G. Golf  
Officer Context: Sergeant F. G. Golf and Sgt. H. I. India reported similar markers in adjacent zones.  
Officer Role: Sergeant 

Officer Name: Sgt. H. I. India  
Officer Context: Sergeant F. G. Golf and Sgt. H. I. India reported similar markers in adjacent zones.  
Officer Role: Sergeant
